author: ryanleeschneider
content: Are GPU miners "discouraged" on Sepolia to keep mining more open?  If so is that actually stopping people? I see all the recent blocks are mined by the same two accounts (I tried CPU mining over lunch to get some eth to test w/ but had no luck), and both accounts have thousands of sepolia ETH.

author: timbeiko
content: I don’t think so? I can send you some Sepolia ETH if you need some <@!388751025789468672>. DM me your address

author: jgm
content:
Last thousand blocks mined on sepolia (blocks per miner):

```
    437 0x45Ff5F8723DAe09D008dae9462346FD806736390
    201 0xD87DEF8BBd2C4d59494611ab259A2005C154212A
    127 0xE276Bc378A527A8792B353cdCA5b5E53263DfB9e
     98 0x8D872D4aD5aE8615c4ce4b5c742895725610E39b
     72 0x0F35B0753E261375C9a6Cb44316b4BdC7e765509
     65 0xDccf8451070a86183eE70D330C4c43b686E9CF86
```

So there is some distribution amongst the 6 miners running.

FYI current difficulty on sepolia is 5144492160.  No idea how to translate that to a GHash/s number, or what that would mean in terms of what you would need to be running to have a decent chance of mining a block.

content: <timbeiko> I’m aware of at least 1 GPU miner mining with a single GPU who mined a few thousand SepoliaETH
